data.prayer: Father, be a refuge and strength for the hurting in Madaba, Jordan today.
data.verse: God is our refuge and strength, an ever-present help in trouble.

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Madaba, Jordan
data.section_summary: What challenges do people here face?

data.prayer: Lord, the believers in the state of Madaba, Jordan need teachers who can feed them with knowledge and understanding. Please raise them up.
data.verse: Then I will give you shepherds after My own heart, who will feed you with knowledge and understanding.

data.prayer: Spirit, teach the children in the state of Madaba to pray with passion and pleading for your presence.
Father, remind your church in Madaba that they can know and depend on the love you have for them.
data.verse: We know and have believed the love which God has for us. God is love, and he who remains in love remains in God, and God remains in him.

data.prayer: Lord, you sent Jesus as a witness to testify about the light so that all the Kurd, Kurmanji people might believe through him.
Father, reveal yourself to a faithful non-believer today, someone like Cornelius, and then Father please connect him with the church in Madaba, Jordan.
data.verse: Cornelius answered: “Three days ago I was in my house praying at this hour, at three in the afternoon. Suddenly a man in shining clothes stood before me and said, ‘Cornelius, God has heard your prayer and remembered your gifts to the poor."

data.prayer: Spirit, teach the 351 believers in Madaba that when they seek first your Kingdom and your righteousness, you will abundantly provide all they need.
data.verse: And God is able to bless you abundantly, so that in all things at all times, having all that you need, you will abound in every good work.

data.prayer: Father, we suspect there is 1 believer for every 375 neighbors who are far from you in Madaba. Please, give courage and opportunity to your children to speak boldly.
data.verse: Pray also for me, that whenever I speak, words may be given me so that I will fearlessly make known the mystery of the gospel.
